TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit EventLogQuery extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Represents a query for events in an event log and the settings that define how the query is executed and on what computer the query is executed on.

remarks.format: ## Examples For example code using this class, see [How To: Query for Events](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/5231a436-4cf2-4539-90d2-a04813aba069) or [How To: Access and Read Event Information](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/14db3375-d305-49ae-aa24-aedbe906e76c).

Docs.related: Technology Summary for Reading and Managing Event Logs

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
Docs.related: Technology Summary for Reading and Managing Event Logs

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string path, valuetype System.Diagnostics.Eventing.Reader.PathType pathType) cil managed

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.param: The name of the event log to query, or the path to the event log file to query.
Specifies whether the string used in the path parameter specifies the name of an event log, or the path to an event log file.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class by specifying the target of the query. The target can be an active event log or a log file.
Docs.related: Technology Summary for Reading and Managing Event Logs

MemberSignature.Value: public EventLogQuery (string path, System.Diagnostics.Eventing.Reader.PathType pathType, string query);
.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string path, valuetype System.Diagnostics.Eventing.Reader.PathType pathType, string query) cil managed
public: EventLogQuery(System::String ^ path, System::Diagnostics::Eventing::Reader::PathType pathType, System::String ^ query);

Docs.param: The name of the event log to query, or the path to the event log file to query.
Specifies whether the string used in the path parameter specifies the name of an event log, or the path to an event log file.
The event query used to retrieve events that match the query conditions.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class by specifying the target of the query and the event query. The target can be an active event log or a log file.
Docs.related: Technology Summary for Reading and Managing Event Logs

set: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the Boolean value that determines whether to read events from the newest event in an event log to the oldest event in the log.
Docs.value: Returns if events are read from the newest event in the log to the oldest event, and returns if events are read from the oldest event in the log to the newest event.
Docs.related: Technology Summary for Reading and Managing Event Logs

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::Diagnostics::Eventing::Reader::EventLogSession ^ Session { System::Diagnostics::Eventing::Reader::EventLogSession ^ get(); void set(System::Diagnostics::Eventing::Reader::EventLogSession ^ value); };

Attribute.AttributeName: get: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")
set: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the session that access the Event Log service on the local computer or a remote computer. This object can be set to access a remote event log by creating a object or an object with this object.
Docs.related: Technology Summary for Reading and Managing Event Logs

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool TolerateQueryErrors { bool get(); void set(bool value); };
member this.TolerateQueryErrors : bool with get, set

Attribute.AttributeName: get: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")
set: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a Boolean value that determines whether this query will continue to retrieve events when the query has an error.
Docs.value: indicates that the query will continue to retrieve events even if the query fails for some logs, and indicates that this query will not continue to retrieve events when the query fails.
Docs.related: Technology Summary for Reading and Managing Event Logs
